snippet: The Social Democrats are hoping that state elections on Sunday in North Rhine-Westphalia, the country’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign.
abstract: Social Democrats, being led by Hannelore Kraft, hope that state elections in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign.
lead_paragraph: The Social Democrats are hoping that state elections on Sunday in North Rhine-Westphalia, the country’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign.

headline.seo: Hannelore Kraft Raises Challenge to Merkel in Germany
headline.main: In Germany’s Most Populous State, a Regional Leader Rises to Challenge Merkel
headline.print_headline: In Germany’s Most Populous State, a Regional Leader Rises to Challenge Merkel
